title: Union J star Josh Cuthbert's model wife Chloe Lloyd shows off endless legs in a striped blazer dress
text:
They tied the knot in a stunning ceremony at Aynhoe Park in Banbury, Oxfordshire last year.

And Josh Cuthbert and his stunning wife Chloe Lloyd looked smitten as they enjoyed a date night at the Buddha Bar restaurant at Grosvenor House Hotel in Dubai on Friday night.

The Union J star's model wife showed off her envy-inducing long legs in a blazer-inspired minidress.

They married last summer in a stunning manor house ceremony at Aynhoe Park in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

The pair married on August 9 2018, in front of a star-studded guests. Radio 1 DJ Scott Mills and Hollyoaks star Sophie Porley were among the guests, as well as Josh's Union J bandmates.

The singer has since left the band, following the previous departure of ex fourth member George Shelley.

Josh shot to fame with the group on X Factor in 2011 and took to Instagram last October to announce the news before apologising to his fans for the departure - which seemingly left his band mates raging.

Taking to Twitter shortly after, the remaining stars, JJ Hamblett and Jaymi Hensley, issued a series of angry messages hitting out at the star.

Josh penned: 'My journey with Union J has been one to remember, and something I will cherish forever. But after seven years, I feel like now is the right time for me to leave the band.

'I'd like to apologise to my fans if I've let anyone down, but I have to do what feels right for me and follow my heart. I have decided to leave, because I want to continue to develop my individual opportunities across entertainment and music...

'I have so many beautiful memories with them and have friends for life in the boys and wish JJ and Jaymi the best for the future. Thank you for your continued support, it’s down to you all that I am where I am today and you all mean the world to me.'

His bandmates tweeted and deleted a host of raging messages in response to the news.

'Things should have been handled differently. This statement should have come to you as a joint statement,' Union J's official account hit back. 'Sadly once again that decision was taken into ones personal matters... There is no beef whatsover, things should have just been handled differently. Not cool.'
